column4: In the Removable Drives and Media Preferences menu, what are the codes for %d and %m?
Pardon me.  Can someone answer a question about Ubuntu's automounting options menus?
ask the question and maybe someone can help :)
do you mean in /media ?
No.  Take a look at the Removable Drives and Media Preferences dialog and you'll see what I mean.
sorry I don't understand the qu..... hehe which dialogue?
in Gnome, go to System -> Preferences -> Removable Drives and Media
ok gotcha...
wow never seen that before :)
well thanks anyway.  I'll keep googling.
sorry I can't help.
I found the answer through playing around if you'd like to know.
yes definitely...
ah i see mc44 told you in -offtopic :)
%d refers to the device, ie /dev/scd0, whereas %m refers to the path, ie /media/cdrom
if there are any other variables, I don't know them.
there's always more :)
tab completion for the win ;)
type the first couple of characters then press <tab>
it works in the terminal as well
yeah, I got it now.
I forgot about it.
